ingredients.name: chocolate chips (I used semi-sweet, but you can use milk chocolate, dark chocolate, or whatever kind you like best)

Candy-coated chocolate chips-- [Wilton Rainbow Chip Crunch 5.25 oz.](http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B001PKUXSI/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&camp=1789&creative=9325&creativeASIN=B001PKUXSI&linkCode=as2&tag=hunghunghigh-20&linkId=SFS4AU7CCZIRBYHB)![](http://ir-na.amazon-adsystem.com/e/ir?t=hunghunghigh-20&l=as2&o=1&a=B001PKUXSI)

steps.description: Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Line a 9x13" pan with a piece of parchment paper and lightly grease.
In a stand mixer, combine melted butter, sugars, and vanilla. Beat on high for 4 minutes. Add eggs and beat again.
Combine dry ingredients (flour, cocoa, baking powder, cornstarch, and salt). Alternating with the milk, add dry ingredients to the butter/sugar mixture. Beat until just combined.
Spread evenly in the pan and bake for 18-24 minutes. Let brownies cool in the pan.

In a microwave-safe bowl, combine chocolate and cream. Microwave for 1 minute, then stir. Continue in 30 second increments until completely smooth. Spread evenly on cooled brownies and top with sprinkles ([Wilton Rainbow Chip Crunch 5.25 oz.](http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B001PKUXSI/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&camp=1789&creative=9325&creativeASIN=B001PKUXSI&linkCode=as2&tag=hunghunghigh-20&linkId=SFS4AU7CCZIRBYHB)![](http://ir-na.amazon-adsystem.com/e/ir?t=hunghunghigh-20&l=as2&o=1&a=B001PKUXSI))
